problem_text: In \odot X, WS, VR, and QT are diameters, m \angle WXV = 25 and m \angle VXU = 45. Find the measure of \widehat WRV.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: QX ⊥ RX, ∠TXS, ∠RXU, ∠TXR, ∠UXS, X on SW, X on QT, Arc(VXW), ∠VXT, ∠SXV, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, RX ⊥ TX, ∠RXT, ∠SXU, X on RV, 3.14 = pi, ∠UXT, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, ∠QXW, ∠SXR, ∠RXQ, ∠WXV, ∠VXU, ∠WXV, TX ⊥ VX

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QX ⊥ RX
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠RXQ

Step 3:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : X on SW, X on QT
Conclusions: ∠QXW = ∠TXS

Step 4:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(VXW)
Conclusions: ∠VXW = Arc(VXW)

Step 5:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠SXV, ∠TXS, ∠VXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠TXS + ∠VXT

Step 6:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : RX ⊥ TX
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RXT, pi / 2 = ∠TXR

Step 7:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : X on SW, X on RV
Conclusions: ∠SXV = ∠WXR, ∠SXR = ∠WXV

Step 8:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXR, ∠UXT, ∠RXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠TXR + ∠UXT

Step 9:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠TXS, ∠SXU, ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 10:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠RXT, ∠TXS, ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXT + ∠SXR + ∠TXS

Step 11:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠UXS, ∠SXR, ∠RXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠SXR + ∠UXS

Step 12:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠WXV
Conclusions: ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 13:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠SXV, ∠UXS, ∠VXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠UXS + ∠VXU

Step 14:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠WXV, ∠TXS, ∠RXQ, ∠QXW, ∠SXR, ∠VXU, ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR + ∠TXS + ∠UXT + ∠VXU + ∠WXV

Step 15:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : TX ⊥ VX
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠VXT

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠SXR = ∠WXV, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR

Step 17:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi / 2 = ∠TXR, 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠TXR + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT

Step 18:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 20:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠SXV = ∠WXR, 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠UXS + ∠VXU, 3.14 = pi, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR

Step 21:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠SXV = ∠WXR, 3.14 = pi, pi / 2 = ∠VXT, 2 * pi = ∠SXV + ∠TXS + ∠VXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR

Step 22:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠RXQ, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, ∠QXW = ∠TXS, 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR + ∠TXS + ∠UXT + ∠VXU + ∠WXV, 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 23:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, 2 * pi = ∠RXU + ∠SXR + ∠UXS
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS

Step 24:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠RXT, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, 2 * pi = ∠RXT + ∠SXR + ∠TXS
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT, 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT, 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 2 * pi = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS, 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 2 * pi = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR, 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 2 * pi = 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR

Step 29:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠RXU + ∠UXS, 2 * pi = (3 * 3.14) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + ∠TXS + ∠WXR, 2 * pi = 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXS + ∠WXR, 2 * pi = 3.14 / 2 + ∠RXU + ∠UXT, pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠VXW

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.85 = ∠VXW, ∠VXW = Arc(VXW)
Conclusions: 5.85 = Arc(VXW)
